comment.desc: You will get the same kind of objects with multiple environments or you can create one based on your requirement
comment.process: just duplicate the development object and set the name as environment name, then that will be used if you set the env value with that name
comment.Note: some keys, dialect you've to check with the system you use ( /* one of 'mysql' | 'mariadb' | 'postgres' | 'mssql' */ )
comment.important: Properly set the env value, before executing anything and check which env is getting use, then you can check that particular env object if any value is mistaken
